str2: Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.
A Chaldean. Probably of Hebrew or; a Chaldoean, or native or the region of the lower Euphrates.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To dwell in, settle in, be established in (permanently), inhabit. From kata and oikeo; to house permanently, i.e. Reside.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Haran. Of Hebrew origin; Charrhan, a place in Mesopotamia.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
To be dying, be about to die, wither, decay. From apo and thnesko; to die off.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From the same as metoikesia; to transfer as a settler or captive, i.e colonize or exile.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
And thence, and from there; and then afterwards. From kai and ekeithen; likewise from that place.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
This; he, she, it.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To dwell in, settle in, be established in (permanently), inhabit. From kata and oikeo; to house permanently, i.e. Reside.
